descr.p: lazutf8.pas contains useful routines for managing UTF-8-encoded strings. All routines are thread-safe unless explicitly stated.
This file is part of the LazUtils package.

element.name: NeedRTLAnsi
element.short: Indicates if the OS requires use of AnsiToUTF8 and UTF8ToAnsi for the RTL.

descr.p: NeedRTLAnsi is a Boolean function that indicates if the OS requires use of AnsiToUTF8 and UTF8ToAnsi for the RTL. AnsiToUTF8 and UTF8ToAnsi need a widestring manager under Linux, BSD, and Mac OSX. Normally these OS's use UTF-8 as the system encoding so the WideStringManager is not needed.

For the Windows environment, NeedRTLAnsi is True if the default system code page is not CP_UTF8. For UNIX-like environments, NeedRTLAnsi is True when any of the LC_ALL, LC_MESSAGES, or LANG environment variables contain a language code other than UTF-8.

element.name: NeedRTLAnsi.Result
element.short: True when the system encoding is not UTF-8.

element.name: SetNeedRTLAnsi
element.short: Sets the value for the unit global variable.

element.name: SetNeedRTLAnsi.NewValue
element.short: New value for the variable.

element.name: UTF8ToSys
element.short: Ensures UTF-8 characters (or format settings) are converted to the system code page.

descr.p: UTF8ToSys is an overloaded function used to convert the specified string value (or format settings) to the system codepage for the platform. UTF8ToSys works like UTF8ToAnsi, but is more independent of WideStringManager. For platforms where UTF8_RTL is not defined, and NeedRTLAnsi returns True, UTF8ToAnsi is called to convert non-ASCII values in s. For platforms where UTF8_RTL is defined, the value in s is used without modification.

An overloaded variant of the function handles TFormatSettings for the platform. The return value for the function is the specified values in AFormatSettings after being updated to reflect the system codepage for the platform. For platforms where UTF8_RTL is not defined, the values in the following format settings are updated: CurrencyString, LongMonthNames, ShortMonthNames, LongDayNames, and ShortDayNames.
No actions are needed for platforms where UTF8_RTL is defined.

element.name: UTF8ToSys.Result
element.short: Value for the string after conversion.

element.name: UTF8ToSys.s
element.short: Value to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8ToSys.AFormatSettings
element.short: Format settings to examine in the function.

element.name: SysToUTF8
element.short: Converts strings (and format settings) from the system codepage to UTF-8.

descr.p: SysToUTF8 is an overloaded function used to convert strings (and format settings) from the system codepage to UTF-8. SysToUTF8 works like AnsiToUTF8, but has no reliance on the widestring manager on platforms where UTF8_RTL is defined. For platforms where UTF8_RTL is not defined, and NeedRTLAnsi contains True, non-ASCII values are converted to UTF-8 by calling AnsiToUTF8.

An overloaded variant of the function handles TFormatSettings for the platform. The return value for the function is the values specified in AFormatSettings after conversion from the system codepage to UTF-8. The values in the following format settings are updated: CurrencyString, LongMonthNames, ShortMonthNames, LongDayNames, and ShortDayNames.

element.name: SysToUTF8.Result
element.short: Values after conversion to UTF-8.

element.name: SysToUTF8.s
element.short: Values to examine in the function.

element.name: SysToUTF8.AFormatSettings
element.short: Format settings to examine in the function.

element.name: ConsoleToUTF8
element.short: Converts an OEM-encoded string to UTF8.

descr.p: ConsoleToUTF8 is a String function used to converts an OEM-encoded string to UTF8. The implementation of ConsoleToUTF8 is OS-specific, and essentially handles differences between various Windows platforms where use of OemToChar and WinCPToUTF8 are required. For UNIX-like environments, the value in s is converted by calling SysToUTF8.
ConsoleToUTF8 is used in the implementation of the GetEnvironmentStringUTF8 and GetEnvironmentVariableUTF8 functions.

element.name: ConsoleToUTF8.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encode value for the string.

element.name: ConsoleToUTF8.s
element.short: Value to convert in the function.

element.name: UTF8ToConsole
element.short: Converts a UTF-8-encoded string to console (OEM) encoding.

descr.p: UTF8ToConsole converts a UTF-8-encoded string to console (OEM) encoding as used in Write and WriteLn. The implementation is platform specific.

For the Windows environment, either UTF8ToSys or UTF8ToWinCP is used to convert the value to the codepage or character set needed in RTL. The Windows CharToOem API is used to prepare the return value. In UNIX-like environments, UTF8ToSys is used to get the return value .

element.name: UTF8ToConsole.Result
element.short: OEM-encoded value for the string.

element.name: UTF8ToConsole.s
element.short: UTF-8-encode input values.

element.name: WinCPToUTF8
element.short: Converts the string from Windows code page to UTF-8.

descr.p: Converts the string from Windows code page to UTF-8. Used with some Windows-specific functions. For all Windows versions supporting 8-bit codepages (but not WinCE).

element.name: WinCPToUTF8.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encoded values for the string.

element.name: WinCPToUTF8.s
element.short: Input values in Windows codepage encoding.

element.name: UTF8ToWinCP
element.short: Converts the UTF-8-encoded string to the Windows code page encoding.

descr.p: Converts the UTF-8-encoded string to the Windows code page encoding Used by Write and WriteLn.

element.name: UTF8ToWinCP.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encoded input values.

element.name: UTF8ToWinCP.s
element.short: Values in the Windows codepage encoding.

element.name: ParamStrUTF8
element.short: Converts the specified command line parameter to a UTF-8-encoded string.

descr.p: ParamStrUTF8 is a String function used to convert the specified command line parameter to a UTF-8-encoded string. The implementation for ParamStrUTF8 is OS- or platform-specific. For UNIX-like environments, SysToUTF8 is called to convert the value for the command line parameter at the position in Param. For Windows platforms like WinCE, the stub for the Ansi or WideString version of ParamStr is called.

element.name: ParamStrUTF8.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encoded value for the command line parameter.

element.name: ParamStrUTF8.Param
element.short: Ordinal position of the command line parameter.

element.name: GetFormatSettingsUTF8
element.short: Gets the TFormatSettings for the platform.

descr.p: GetFormatSettingsUTF8 is a procedure used to get the TFormatSettings for the Locale or Language Code for the platform. GetFormatSettingsUTF8 is defined for Windows environments only, and calls GetLocaleFormatSettingsUTF8 using the ThreadLocale or Language Code ID needed for the platform.

element.name: GetLocaleFormatSettingsUTF8
element.short: Gets format settings for a specific Lanuguage Code ID.

descr.p: GetLocaleFormatSettingsUTF8 is a procedure used to get the TFormatSettings for the Locale or Language Code for the platform. GetFormatSettingsUTF8 is defined for Windows environments only. GetLocaleFormatSettingsUTF8 ensures that values in the format settings use the Language Code ID for the platform. The following format settings are converted to their Locale-specific values:

element.name: GetLocaleFormatSettingsUTF8.LCID
element.short: Language Code ID.

element.name: GetLocaleFormatSettingsUTF8.AFormatSettings
element.short: The locale-specific format settings for the platform.

element.name: GetEnvironmentVariableCountUTF8
element.short: Returns the number of system environment variables.

descr.p: Returns the number of UTF-8-encoded system environment variables. Used together with GetEnvironmentStringUTF8.

element.name: GetEnvironmentVariableCountUTF8.Result
element.short: Number of variables in the system environment.

element.name: GetEnvironmentStringUTF8
element.short: Returns a system environment string.

descr.p: Returns a UTF-8-encoded system environment string stored at the specified position. The value in Index is in the range 1..GetEnvironmentVariableCountUTF8. For Unix and Windows the string normally is in the form 'name=value'. Beware that Windows knows some special formats, e.g. '=C:=SomePath'. Nota bene: Raymond Chen called these "bookkeeping variables" which emulate the MS-DOS tracking mechanism for the current directory on different drives.
Use GetEnvironmentVariableUTF8 to lookup values for environment variables by name.

element.name: GetEnvironmentStringUTF8.Result
element.short: Value for the environment variable at the specified position.

element.name: GetEnvironmentStringUTF8.Index
element.short: Position for the environment variable.

element.name: GetEnvironmentVariableUTF8
element.short: Returns the value of a system environment variable.

descr.p: Returns the value of an environment variable stored in the form 'EnvVar=value'. See GetEnvironmentStringUTF8 to retrieve the whole list of environment strings.

element.name: GetEnvironmentVariableUTF8.Result
element.short: Value for the specified environment variable name.

element.name: GetEnvironmentVariableUTF8.EnvVar
element.short: Environment variable with the value retrieved in the routine.

element.name: SysErrorMessageUTF8
element.short: Gets the UTF-8-encoded system error message for the specified error code.

descr.p: SysErrorMessageUTF8 is used to get the UTF-8-encoded system error message for the specified error code. SysErrorMessageUTF8 calls the SysUtils.SysErrorMessage function and converts the error message using SysToUTF8.

element.name: SysErrorMessageUTF8.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encoded value for the system error message.

element.name: SysErrorMessageUTF8.ErrorCode
element.short: Numeric system error code for the message.

element.name: UTF8CodepointSize
element.short: Returns the size of the UTF-8 codepoint in bytes.

descr.p: Returns the size of the UTF-8 codepoint in bytes. The return value is for a single codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CodepointSize.Result
element.short: Number of bytes for the codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CodepointSize.p
element.short: UTF-8-encoded value to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8CodepointSizeFast
element.short: Fast version of UTF8CodepointSize.

descr.p: Fast version of UTF8CodepointSize. Assumes the UTF-8 codepoint is valid. The return value is for a single codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CodepointSizeFast.Result
element.short: Number of bytes for the codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CodepointSizeFast.p
element.short: Encoded values to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8CharacterLength
element.short: Returns the number of bytes needed for the UTF-8 codepoint starting at p.

descr.p: It returns 0 if p is nil. It returns 1 if p is a 1-byte UTF-8 codepoint or p is an invalid UTF-8 sequence. Otherwise it returns a number 2..4. It does not check for malicious codepoints like #$c0#$80, nor for undefined codepoints like #$f3#$a0#$87#$b9. Use UTF8CharacterLength to step through a string with a simple loop:
Even if p contains invalid UTF-8 codepoints it will run through the string without overflow.

element.name: UTF8CharacterLength.Result
element.short: Number of bytes required for the UTF-8 codepoint, or 0 (zero).

element.name: UTF8CharacterLength.p
element.short: Pointer to the value examined in the routine.

element.name: UTF8Length
element.short: Gets the length of a UTF-8-encoded string in codepoints.

descr.p: UTF8Length is a function used to get the character length for the specified UTF-8-encoded string. The return value contains the number of UTF-8-encoded characters (or codepoints) found in the byte values for the string.
An overloaded variant of the function is provided which uses the PChar type to access the byte values in the string.

element.name: UTF8Length.Result
element.short: Number of codepoints in the byte values for the string.

element.name: UTF8Length.s
element.short: UTF-8-encoded string to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8Length.p
element.short: Pointer to the UTF-8-encoded string to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8Length.ByteCount
element.short: Number of byte values in the UTF-8-encoded string.

element.name: UTF8LengthFast
element.short: Fast version of UTF8Length.

descr.p: UTF8LengthFast gets the length of a UTF-8-encoded string in codepoints (or characters). UTF8LengthFast is the fast version of UTF8Length. It does not call the UTF8CodepointSize function. The UTF-8-encoded data is assumed to be valid. The native data size for the CPU is used to process blocks of UTF-8-encoded data. For a 64-bit CPU, this means that 8 bytes are read and processed at once.

element.name: UTF8LengthFast.Result
element.short: Number of codepoints in the string.

element.name: UTF8LengthFast.s
element.short: String with UTF-8-encoded values.

element.name: UTF8LengthFast.p
element.short: Pointer to the String with UTF-8-encoded values.

element.name: UTF8LengthFast.ByteCount
element.short: Number of byte values in the UTF-8-encoded string.

element.name: UTF8CodepointToUnicode
element.short: Converts a UTF-8-encoded character to its unique Unicode U+XXXX character value.

descr.p: UTF8CodepointToUnicode is a Cardinal function used to convert a UTF-8-encoded character to its representation as a unique Unicode U+XXXX hexadecimal character value. For example: The letter 'A' (Decimal 65) is expressed in Unicode as U+0041.

CodepointLen is an output variable used to store the number of UTF-8-encoded bytes needed for the codepoint. It will normally contain a value in the range 1..4 (the number of possible bytes used in the UTF-8 encoding scheme). It can contain 0 (zero) when p is an empty PChar value.
The return value for the function contains the hexadecimal Unicode character value as a Cardinal data type. It can contain 0 (zero) when the value in p is not a valid UTF-8-encoded character.
Use UTF8FixBroken to fix invalid UTF-8 encoding in the string.
Use UnicodeToUTF8 to convert a Unicode character value to its UTF-8-encoded value.
descr.remark: UTF8CodepointToUnicode does not check whether the codepoint is actually defined in Unicode tables.

element.name: UTF8CodepointToUnicode.Result
element.short: Unicode character value for the UTF-8 character.

element.name: UTF8CodepointToUnicode.p
element.short: The UTF-8-encode string value.

element.name: UTF8CodepointToUnicode.CodepointLen
element.short: Number of bytes needed for the codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CharacterToUnicode
element.short: Returns the codepoint at p and the number of bytes to skip.

descr.p: If p=nil then CharLen and result are 0 otherwise CharLen>0. If there is an encoding error the Result is 0 and CharLen=1 to skip forward. It is safe to do:
For speed reasons, this function only checks for 1, 2, 3, or 4 byte encoding errors. It does not check whether the codepoint is defined in the Unicode table.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8
element.short: Encodes the given code point as an UTF-8 sequence of 1 to 4 bytes.

descr.p: UnicodeToUTF8 is an Integer function used to convert the Unicode character value in CodePoint to the sequence of bytes needed for the UTF-8 encoding. UnicodeToUTF8 stores the UTF-8-encoded byte values for the Unicode character in the Buf parameter.
The return value contains the number of bytes required for the UTF-8-encoded value (in the range 1..4). If it contains 0 (zero), the Unicode codepoint was invalid and an Exception is raised.
descr.remark: UnicodeToUTF8 does not process #0 byte values for the codepoint, as done for UTF-32.

errors.p: Raises an Exception when Utf8TryFindCodepointStartCodePoint is an invalid Unicode character value. Raised with the message 'UnicodeToUTF8: invalid Unicode: XXXXXXXX'.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8.Result
element.short: Number of bytes needed for the UTF-8-encode value.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8.Codepoint
element.short: Unicode character value to convert in the function.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8.Buf
element.short: Stores the UTF-8-encoded byte values for the codepoint.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8SkipErrors
element.short: Stores a single Unicode codepoint as a UTF-8-encoded value in the buffer.

descr.p: UnicodeToUTF8SkipErrors is a simple and fast function used to write a single Unicode codepoint as a UTF-8-encoded value in Buf. It returns the number of bytes written. It does not append a terminating null (#0) character. It does not check if the codepoint actually exists in Unicode tables. It returns 0 if the codepoint can not be represented as a 1 to 4 byte UTF-8 sequence.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8SkipErrors.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encoded value for the codepoint.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8SkipErrors.Codepoint
element.short: Codepoint (Unicode character) to convert in the function.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8SkipErrors.Buf
element.short: Buffer where the converted value is stored.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8Inline
element.short: Encodes the given code point as an UTF-8 sequence of 1 to 4 bytes.

descr.p: UnicodeToUTF8Inline is an Integer function used to convert the Unicode character value in CodePoint to the sequence of bytes needed for the UTF-8 encoding. UnicodeToUTF8Inline stores the UTF-8-encoded byte values for the Unicode character in the Buf parameter.
The return value contains the number of bytes required for the UTF-8-encoded value (in the range 1..4).
Used in the implementation of UnicodeToUTF8 and UnicodeToUTF8SkipErrors.
descr.remark: UnicodeToUTF8Inline does not process #0 byte values for the codepoint, as done for UTF-32.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8Inline.Result
element.short: Number of bytes required for the UTF-8-encoded value.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8Inline.CodePoint
element.short: Unicode character value to convert.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF8Inline.Buf
element.short: Destination where encoded byte values are stored.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByteString
element.short: Converts UTF-8 values to their DBCS equivalent.

descr.p: UTF8ToDoubleByteString is a String function used to convert UTF-8-encoded values to the representation used in Double Byte Character Sets (DBCS).

UTF8ToDoubleByteString calls UTF8Length to get the number of codepoints (or characters) in s, and calls UTF8ToDoubleByte to perform the conversion. Each codepoint is converted to Unicode by calling UTF8CodepointToUnicode.
The return value is a String type with the byte values from the conversion, or an empty string ('') when s does not contain a valid UTF-8-encoded string.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByteString.Result
element.short: DBCS values for the specified codepoints.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByteString.s
element.short: UTF-8-encoded values to convert in the function.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByte
element.short: Converts a UTF-8-encode string to its DBCS representation.

descr.p: UTF8ToDoubleByte is used to convert UTF-8-encoded values to the representation used in Double Byte Character Sets (DBCS). UTF8ToDoubleByte calls UTF8CodepointToUnicode to process each of the codepoints in UTF8Str.
The return value contains the byte values from the conversion.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByte.Result
element.short: Number of double bytes converted in the function.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByte.UTF8Str
element.short: UTF-8-encoded values to convert in the function.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByte.Len
element.short: Length of the UTF-8-encoded input values.

element.name: UTF8ToDoubleByte.DBStr
element.short: Storage for the Double Byte values.

element.name: UTF8FindNearestCharStart
element.short: Finds the start of the UTF-8 character at the specified position.

descr.p: Find the start of the UTF-8 character which contains BytePos. If BytePos is not part of a valid UTF-8 Codepoint the function returns BytePos. BytePos values starts at position 0.
Len is the length in bytes.

element.name: UTF8FindNearestCharStart.Result
element.short: Position where the next codepoint begins.

element.name: UTF8FindNearestCharStart.UTF8Str
element.short: Values to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8FindNearestCharStart.Len
element.short: Length of the input values.

element.name: UTF8FindNearestCharStart.BytePos
element.short: Offset into UTF8Str for the initial byte value.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart
element.short: Tries to find the start of a valid UTF-8 codepoint in a string.

descr.p: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart is a Boolean function which tries to find the start of a valid UTF-8 codepoint at the specified position in AString.

The return value contains True if the bytes at the specified position are a valid UTF-8 codepoint (1 - 4 bytes). When the return value is True, the value in CurPos is updated to contain the position in AString where the UTF-8 codepoint begins. Otherwise, the value in CurPos is unchanged. Please note, when CurPos points beyond the end of AString you will get a crash!
descr.remark: UTF8CodepointStrictSize will NOT "look" beyond the terminating #0 in a PChar, so this is safe with AnsiString values.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart.Result
element.short: True when the bytes at the specified position are a valid UTF-8 codepoint.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart.AString
element.short: Pointer to the string to examine in the function.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart.CurPos
element.short: Pointer to the first position in the string examined in the function.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart.CodepointLen
element.short: Number of bytes in the codepoint, or 0 when invalid.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart.Index
element.short: Initial position in the string examined in the function.

element.name: Utf8TryFindCodepointStart.CharLen
element.short: Number of bytes required for the UTF-8 codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStart
element.short: Finds the n-th UTF-8 codepoint.

descr.p: Finds the n-th UTF-8 codepoint, ignoring BIDI.
Len is the length in bytes for the values in UTF8Str. CodepointIndex is the position of the desired codepoint (starting at 0), in characters.
The return value contains the byte values for the codepoint, or Nil when a valid codepoint was not found.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStart.Result
element.short: Byte values for the codepoint, or Nil.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStart.UTF8Str
element.short: Values to examine in the function.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStart.Len
element.short: Length in bytes for the input values.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStart.CodepointIndex
element.short: Character position for the desired codepoint (zero-based).

element.name: UTF8CodepointToByteIndex
element.short: Finds the byte index of the n-th UTF-8 codepoint.

descr.p: Finds the byte index of the n-th UTF-8 codepoint, ignoring BIDI (byte len of substr).

element.name: UTF8FixBroken
element.short: Replaces all invalid UTF-8 characters with spaces.

descr.p: Replaces all invalid UTF-8 characters with spaces. Stops at the first occurrence of the byte value #0 (Decimal 0).

element.name: UTF8CodepointStrictSize
element.short: Gets the number of bytes needed for the UTF-8 codepoint.

descr.p: Gets the number of bytes needed for the UTF-8 codepoint in P. The return value contains the number of bytes need for the codepoint (in the range 1..4), or 0 (zero) when P is not assigned or the codepoint is invalid.
descr.remark: UTF8CodepointStrictSize stops examining the byte values in P when #0 is encountered.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStrictSize.Result
element.short: Number of bytes needed for the codepoint.

element.name: UTF8CodepointStrictSize.P
element.short: UTF-8-encoded values to examine.

element.name: UTF8CharacterStrictLength
element.short: Returns the length in bytes (1..4) for a valid UTF-8 character. Otherwise 0.

element.name: UTF8CStringToUTF8String
element.short: Copies from a C-style string with UTF-8 encoding to UTF-8 string.

descr.p: UTF8CStringToUTF8String is a String function used to copy the specified number of characters (codepoints) from a C-style string with UTF-8 encoding. The return value is a UTF-encoded string with C-style specials characters converted to their common equivalents. The following C-style quoted characters are handled in the function:

dl.dd: Converted to a Tab character (Decimal 9)
Converted to a Double Quote character (Decimal 34)
Converted to a Reverse Solidus character (Decimal 92)
Converted to the LineEnding ending for the OS or platform

descr.p: The return value is a string which contains the number of codepoints in SourceStart specified in SourceLen, or an empty string ('') when SourceLen is 0 (zero).

element.name: UTF8CStringToUTF8String.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encode string with C-style quoting removed.

element.name: UTF8CStringToUTF8String.SourceStart
element.short: PChar with the UTF-8-encoded C-style string.

element.name: UTF8CStringToUTF8String.SourceLen
element.short: Number of codepoints to copy in the method.

element.name: UTF8Pos
element.short: Returns the character index where the search text starts in the string.

descr.p: Returns the character index where SearchForText starts in SearchInText. An optional StartPos can be given to start searching at a given character index. StartPos starts at 1.
Returns 0 if the search text is not found in the string.

element.name: UTF8Pos.Result
element.short: Character position where the search text was located.

element.name: UTF8Pos.SearchForText
element.short: Value to locate in the string.

element.name: UTF8Pos.SearchInText
element.short: String to search for the specified value.

element.name: UTF8Copy
element.short: Copies the specified number of codepoints from the UTF-8-encoded string.

descr.p: UTF8Copy is a String function used copy to UTF-8-encoded values from s starting at the position in StartCharIndex. CharCount specifies the number of multi-byte characters (or codepoints) to include in the return value. The return value is an empty string ('') when s is not a valid UTF-8-encoded string.
UTF8Copy behaves like a substring function.

element.name: UTF8Copy.Result
element.short: String with codepoints copied from the specified source.

element.name: UTF8Copy.s
element.short: String with values to copy in the function.

element.name: UTF8Copy.StartCharIndex
element.short: Initial character position for the copy operation.

element.name: UTF8Copy.CharCount
element.short: Number of characters (codepoints) to copy in the function.

element.name: UTF8Delete
element.short: Deletes characters (or codepoints) in a UTF-8-encoded string.

descr.p: UTF8Delete is an overloaded procedure used to delete characters (or codepoints) in a UTF-8-encoded string starting at a given position.

StartCharIndex contains the character position in s where values will be removed. StartCharIndex refers to codepoints and not individual byte or character values. A single character can be expressed as 1-4 byte values in UTF-8 encoding. CharCount indicates the number of codepoints to remove in the function.
The value in s is updated directly in the function.

An overloaded variant of the procedure is provided for platforms where the Win1252 code page is used. On these platforms, raw byte values values in s are converted to the UTF-8 code page prior to performing the delete operation.

element.name: UTF8Delete.s
element.short: String with values to delete in the procedure.

element.name: UTF8Delete.StartCharIndex
element.short: Initial character position where values will be deleted.

element.name: UTF8Delete.CharCount
element.short: Number of characters (or codepoints) to remove in the procedure.

element.name: UTF8Insert
element.short: Inserts the specified values into a string at the given position.

descr.p: Inserts the specified values into a string at the given position. The value in StartCharIndex starts at 1, and represents the n-th codepoint in the string where values are inserted.

element.name: UTF8Insert.source
element.short: UTF-8 String where values are inserted.

element.name: UTF8Insert.s
element.short: Values to insert into the original string.

element.name: UTF8Insert.StartCharIndex
element.short: Starting character position (1-based) for the new values.

element.name: UTF8StringReplace
element.short: Replaces values in a String matching a pattern starting at a given position.

descr.p: UTF8StringReplace is an overloaded String function which replaces values in a String matching a pattern starting at a given position.

S is the UTF-8-encoded string to update in the function. OldPattern is a pattern with the values to be replaced. NewPattern is the values used to replace the value in OldPattern. Flags contains TReplaceFlags values to use for the operation. ALanguage is the Language Code used for values in function. Count is an output variable used to return the number of replacements performed in the function.
The return value is a UTF-8-encoded string with the updated values following replacement.
UTF8StringReplace uses the same algorithm as the StringReplace function, but uses UTF8LowerCase for case insensitive search (when enabled in Flags).

element.name: UTF8StringReplace.Result
element.short: UTF-8-encoded values after the replace operation.

element.name: UTF8StringReplace.S
element.short: Original UTF-8-encoded values to examine.

element.name: UTF8LowerCase
element.short: Converts the specified string to lowercase using Unicode case mapping rules.

descr.p: UTF8LowerCase is a String function used to convert the UTF-8-encoded value in AInStr to its lowercase equivalent. UTF8LowerCase uses Unicode Data defined at the Unicode.org website. The conversion is performed using the Case Mapping Rules defined here.

ALanguage indicates the language code to use for the conversion. ALanguage should be specified using ISO 639-1 format, which uses 2 characters to represent each language. If the language has no code in ISO 639-1, then the 3-chars code from ISO 639-2 should be used. For example: "tr"for the Turkish language locale. Special handling is provided in the function for Turkish ('tr') and Azeri ('az') language codes. ALanguage can be set to an empty string ('') for maximum speed in the conversion.

element.name: UTF8UpperCase
element.short: Converts the specified string to uppercase using Unicode case mapping rules.

descr.p: UTF8UpperCase is a String function used to convert the UTF-8-encoded value in AInStr to its uppercase equivalent. UTF8UpperCase uses Unicode Data as defined at the Unicode.org website. The conversion is performed using the Case Mapping Rules defined here.

ALanguage indicates the language code to use for the conversion. ALanguage should be specified using ISO 639-1 format, which uses 2 characters to represent each language. If the language has no code in ISO 639-1, then the 3-chars code from ISO 639-2 should be used. For example: "tr"for the Turkish language locale. Special handling is provided in the function for Turkish ('tr') and Azeri ('az') language codes.ALanguage can be set to an empty string ('') for maximum speed in the conversion.

element.name: UTF8SwapCase
element.short: Provides a simplistic implementation of UTF8UpperCase and UTF8LowerCase.

descr.p: UTF8SwapCase provides a "naive" implementation that uses UTF8UpperCase and UTF8LowerCase. Performance is acceptable for short and reasonably long strings, but it could benefit from better performance and lower memory consumption.

AInStr contains a UTF-8-encoded string with values to convert it the method. Each character in AInStr will have its case "toggled" in the function. In other words, an uppercase character is converted to lowercase, and vice versa.

ALanguage indicates the language code to use for the conversion. ALanguage should be specified using ISO 639-1 format, which uses 2 characters to represent each language. If the language has no code in ISO 639-1, then the 3-character code from ISO 639-2 should be used. For example: "tr"for the Turkish language locale. Special handling is provided in the function for Turkish ('tr') and Azeri ('az') language codes. ALanguage can be set to an empty string ('') for maximum speed in the conversion.

No actions are performed in the method when the number of bytes for the converted value differs from the number of bytes in the original value. In this case, the return value contains the unmodified string in AInStr. The return value is an empty string ('') when AInStr is an empty string ('').

descr.p: FindInvalidUTF8Codepoint is a PtrInt function used to find the position where an invalid UTF-8 codepoint is located in the specified value. The return value contains -1 when none of the values in p are invalid, or the zero-based offset into p where the invalid encoding was located.

StopOnNonUTF8 indicates if the function should exit when an encoded value is found that is not defined for the UTF-8 encoding, or for single byte characters inserted in the middle of a UTF-8 encoding (used in XSS attacks).

descr.p: It always stops on irregular codepoints. For example Codepoint 0 is normally encoded as #0, but it can also be encoded as #192#0. Because most software does not check this, it can be exploited and is a security risk. If StopOnNonUTF8 is false it will ignore undefined codes. For example #128. By default it stops on such codes.

The return value is filled with byte values for the codepoint (1 to 4 bytes as per the UTF-8 encoding). The process is repeated until the number of codepoints in N have been stored in the return value.

element.name: Utf8EscapeControlChars
element.short: Translates control characters in a UTF-8-encoded string into human readable format.

descr.p: Utf8EscapeControlChars translates control characters inside a UTF-8-encoded string into human readable format. Characters in the range 0..31 are converted into the human-readable values for the control characters in the format specified by EscapeMode, including:

dl.dd: Pascal-style escape characters '#27'
Pascal-style hexadecimal strings '#$1B'
C-style hexadecimal strings '\0x1B'
C-style strings '\e'
ASCII-style control names '[ESC]'

descr.p: Utf8EscapeControlChars calls FindInvalidUTF8Codepoint to see if S contains any invalid codepoints for the UTF-8 encoding. UTF8FixBroken is called to repair the input value.

Utf8EscapeControlChars iterates over the characters in S, and converts any value in the eligible range using an internal lookup table for the value in EscapeMode. All other character values (or values in multi-byte UTF-8 code points) are included in the return value in their unmodified form.

descr.p: UTF16ToUTF8 is a TConvertResult function used to convert the specified UTF-16-encoded string (system endian) to UTF-8 encoding.

element.name: LazGetLanguageIDs
element.short: Gets the Language ID and a fallback value for the platform.

descr.p: LazGetLanguageIDs is a procedure used to get the primary language ID and a fallback value. The values are returned in the Lang and FallbackLang variable parameters.

The implementation for the routine is platform or operating-system specific. For the Darwin platform, localizations in the Main bundle are checked for language and fallback values. For other platforms, the GetLanguageIDs routine in the GetText unit is called is called to get the default Language Code ID. The value in FallbackLang appends the country code to the value in Lang.

element.name: LazGetLanguageIDs.Lang
element.short: Language code for the platform.

element.name: LazGetLanguageIDs.FallbackLang
element.short: Fallback language code for the platform.

element.name: LazGetShortLanguageID
element.short: Removes country information from a language ID.

descr.p: LazGetShortLanguageID strips country information from the language ID, making it simpler to use. Ideally the resulting ID should conform to ISO 639-1, or ISO 639-2 when the language code is not in ISO 639-1.

element.name: LazGetShortLanguageID.Lang
element.short: Language ID examined in the routine.

element.name: FPUpChars
element.short: Contains uppercase characters for all values in the char type.

descr.p: FPUpChars is an array of char type and uses the Lower and Upper bounds permitted for the char type. Values in FPUpChars are assigned in the initialization section for the lazutf8.pas unit, and contains the uppercase equivalent for all characters in the char type.

element.name: UTF8GetStandardCodePage
element.short: Gets the default system code page for the wide string manager.

descr.p: UTF8GetStandardCodePage is a TSystemCodePage function used to get the default code page for strings in the Wide String manager. UTF8GetStandardCodePage is implemented for Windows platforms that use a UTF-8-enabled Run-time Library (RTL). It is assigned as the procedure used by the wide string manager for the platform.
stdcp contains the TStandardCodePageEnum enumeration value that identifies the default code page for the platform.
The return value is set from the CP_UTF8 constant.
